transcripts.text: Welcome to the 21 Convention 2019 of Orlando, Florida.

From my experience, the 21 Convention is a coming of the minds for various wide ranges of topics, be it health and wellness, fitness, dating, relationships, even finance and entrepreneurship.  And I find that really valuable and important.
To me, it's real-world accountability.  Men need to start meeting up with other men.  Be held accountable.  And then you'll find the consequences of that.

We're here to experience these things.  We can only really learn from experience.  That's why somebody who's very book-smart is not wise.  My big thing with it is just having awareness.  That's the problem, is that people will experience the same problem over and over again.  They lack that self-awareness.

And a lot of guys get caught in this kind of analysis paralysis.  What's my perfect plan or anything?  And so you can't think your way into being a better version of yourself.  You just have to act.  You have to do stuff.  And a lot of guys get scared.  And I think that's one of the big differences between the kind of guys who become the speakers.  These are the guys who are actually doing things as opposed to just theorizing or talking about them.

I think we're suffering from a lack of father energy in our culture.  Either fathers aren't there or if they're there, they're weak.  I was blessed to have a strong father.  I didn't understand the power of having a strong father until I was much older.
I definitely recommend going through it.  You're interacting with a whole bunch of great people.  You get to interact with the speakers.
I look forward to walking away from this event with tools, strategies, and steps for me to take going forward on how I can improve my own life, be it in fitness or with starting up my own business.
Talking to a lot of guys, I would see guys and I'm like, so what did you think?  They go... They did this like their mind was blown kind of thing.  And I thought, wow, good, good.  That said it all.
This is awesome.  And it was so positive.  Like you talk about hope, optimism, positivity.  That was this event.
Got to be strong.  To be a strong man is inside and out.  And one of the speakers this weekend said so poetically and beautifully that if you're not strong, you're weak.
